question.body: Sometimes it is very difficult for students to keep track of scientific vocabulary, especially when new words sound a lot like words they already know. Which of the following statements are correct concerning compliment and complement?

multiple_choice.choice: The scientist complemented the graduate student on the quality of the presentation.
The compliment mediated pathway is an important part of our defense against pathogens.
The proteins in the complement system must be activated before they can take part in opsonization.
The kinin-kallikrein system is not part of the compliment defense system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the wrong word; the correct word is compliment.
Incorrect. This is the wrong word; the correct word is complement.
Correct. This is the correct usage of complement.
Incorrect. Compliment is incorrect here. It should be complement.

question.body: Which of the following phrases does NOT correctly describe the role of fever in innate body defense?

multiple_choice.choice: Fever production is the normal response to pyrogens.
Fever results when the hypothalamic thermostat is reset to a higher temperature.
Fever inhibits the growth of some microbes.
Fever reduces the availability of iron and zinc required for bacterial proliferation.
Fever increases metabolism that aid the repair processes.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Pyrogens released by macrophages reset the hypothalamic thermostat.
Incorrect. Pyrogens released by macrophages elevate body temperature due to setting the thermostat to a higher setpoint.
Incorrect. Microbes only grow in certain temperature ranges. By elevating the temperature above this range microbial growth is inhibited.
Correct. This is not a function of fever; this is the role of transferrins.
Incorrect. Fevers speed up chemical reactions in the repair process.
